description: Borrowed from New Latin mēninx, from Ancient Greek μῆνῐγξ (mêninx, “membrane of the eye; membrane enclosing the brain; eardrum”).

entries.meaning: (anatomy, usually in the plural) A membrane, especially one of the three membranes lining the skull and vertebral canal and enclosing the brain and spinal cord in vertebrates.
examples: Meronyms: arachnoid mater, dura mater, pia mater
